result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Francis Griffin

records.addlTxt: AMENDED Pre Trial Order State vs. Timothy Fancis Griffin

2:59 PM Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Timothy Francis Griffin.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF316, 22CF14, and 21CT140. State indicates that results have not bee received from the lab. The substance is disputed between parties. Asks that the trial be adjourned until the results are back from the lab. Notes substances were submitted in January. Asks for new trial dates in January. Attorney Nelsen agrees with state about dispute over what the substance is. Agrees to resetting trial date.
Jury trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:35 AM Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Timothy Francis Griffin.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State gives update that blood results have not been tested yet. Attorney Nelsen notes defendant is concerned on what evidence will show and premature for trial to be set. Court notes trial date may speed up lab results. Court sets pretrial and jury trial dates.
Jury trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:50 PM Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Timothy Francis Griffin.  Attorney Chad La Lor appearing on behalf of Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews the process and trouble of obtaining new counsel through the Public Defender's Office. Defendant makes statement. Court reviews options for defendant in regards to counsel. Defendant is withdrawing request to fire Attorney Nelsen. Attorney Nelsen in agreement. Court withdraws motion to withdraw counsel.

11:34 AM Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Timothy Francis Griffin.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes labs have been sent. Attorney Nelsen notes pending cases in another county and matters would not wrap up before Douglas Co cases. Both parties in agreement to set for status conference.
Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Letter to Judge Thimm from Defendant

10:14 AM Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen. Defendant Timothy Griffin in custody. Prosecuting Atty Angela M Wilson appeared for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF14, Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Nelsen notes State recently made an offer. Defers to State when lab result would be ready. State notes up to six months for test results to come back and will follow up with lab. Attorney Nelsen asks for 45 days out for a status conference. Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.pdf

records.addlTxt:
Calling Cases 2022CF14 for preliminary hearing, 2021CF316 and 2022TR193 for STC
10:39 AM Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State calls Mackenzie Ohm, s/t
Deputy Douglas County Sheriff's Office
1/17/22 on duty, traffic stop in township of Superior Douglas County WI
Witness identifies defendant.  Does not need him to lower mask to make affirmative identification.
Attorney Nelsen-argues that he does not know how an identification can be made with a mask on and only half of face showing.
Record reflects identification of defendant

Attorney Nelsen cross examines witness
 
Court questions witness

Exhibit 1-cert copy bail sheet 21CF316 marked, State requesting Court take judicial notice. Bond conditions.
Offered and received.

State final comments
Defense final comments; bond sheet is not signed by defendant but was signed by Court Clerk

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment.
Reminds of bail/conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
09:26 AM Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen (by Zoom)  Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls the cases; Attorney called to say that he had car trouble and could not be here in person; if the matter is contested, the matter needs to be rescheduled so attorney can appear in person
Atty Nelson-did have difficulty starting vehicle; spoke with client a couple days ago and he has questions about the chemical testing; State indicated that they would have testimony regarding that subject; did not confer with client about waiving the preliminary hearing; request matter be reset
Court finds good cause to adjourn the hearing
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.

03:09 PM Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Timothy Francis Griffin in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicates his address is Douglas County Jail. He indicates he would go to Sawyer County Jail. Atty Nelsen has not seen a copy of the complaint and is unware of charges with the new file.  Atty Nelsen indicated that he didn't know if the defendant was needing to apply for the Public Defender again or if he would be appointed to the case.  Court has Atty Nelsen appear on the older matter and indicates Ms. Craker may be able to make a special appearance on the newer file. Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance for 21CF316. State makes request for the older file. State requests $3000 cash bond with continued conditions No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. In addition to the failure to appear here, defendant is in warrant status as he previously stated in Sawyer County. Atty Nelsen responds that defendant is indigent and unable to post cash bail. 
Court has several concerns here and now there are new charges and pending charges in Sawyer County. Court Orders $3000 cash bond with conditions of  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant must update address wtih 24 hour upon release from Jail. Appearance on the new file, Mr. Nelsen has not yet been appointed. Court inquires with Atty. Craker for special appearance. Atty Craker indicates her associate just emailed Mr. Nelsen a copy of the new complaint. An evaluation was done earlier and defendant does still quailfy.  Court inquires if Atty Nelsen is able to appear on the new case for the defendant. Atty Nelsen indicates he is in receipt of the 3 page complaint. Atty Nelsen acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives further reading, enter pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor counts and ask that the remainder be set for preliminary examination. Court will accept the not guilty plea for any misdemeanor counts and set the matter for preliminary hearing. Court will set the older file for State Conference at the same time. State requests $5000 cash with conditions No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  There are open files in Sawyer County. There are concerns about the quanty of Fentanyl and the defendant fled from officers. Atty Nelsen requests the $3000 cash in 21CF316 will be concurrent with 22CF14. 
Court does have separate concerns. Court indicates Atty. Nelsen asserted defendant is indigent and unable to post. Court Orders $2000 cash bond for a total of $5000 with conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. Preliminary Hearing is set for January 26, 2022 at 9:30 am and Status Conference also held January 26, 2022 at 9:30 am.
Trailing Citation (22TR193)to follow 21CF316 and 22CF14 case.
